content: This iconic tower, completed in 1930, was once the tallest building in the world and remains a symbol of New York City. What is it called?

That's the Empire State Building! It's a skyscraper in Midtown Manhattan, New York City. It was completed in 1930 and held the title of the tallest building in the world until 1970 when the World Trade Center was built. Even though it's not the tallest anymore, it's still a really famous landmark and symbol of New York City.
